channel.title: Creating a dynamic link to a query
channel.description: I am trying to create a dynamic link to a query that a user can click from a 3rd system. The reason the link needs to be dynamic is I want to pass in a URL parameter in the where clause. Can this be done? I saw this documentation but I'm not sure how to use it. https://redash.io/help/user-guide/querying/query-parameters > **Can I change parameter values via the URL?** > > Yes. Each parameter appears in the URL query string preceded by `p_`. A query with id `1234` and the following query text: > > ``` > SELECT * FROM table WHERE field = {{param}} > ``` > > Would have link a like so: `https://app.redash.io/<slug>/queries/1234?p_param=100` > > This is useful for linking between queries and dashboards.

item.title: Creating a dynamic link to a query
item.dc:creator: mbajwa2
item.description:
I guess my question is, how do I formulate this URL? I am not sure what ‘slug’ is

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a dynamic link to a query

item.description:
I’m sorry, what part of the documentation is unclear? As you found this exact behaviour is supported.

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a dynamic link to a query

item.title: Creating a dynamic link to a query
item.dc:creator: mbajwa2
item.description:
I am trying to create a dynamic link to a query that a user can click from a 3rd system.
The reason the link needs to be dynamic is I want to pass in a URL parameter in the where clause.
Can this be done? I saw this documentation but I’m not sure how to use it.

redash.io

Query Parameters

Can I change parameter values via the URL?

Yes. Each parameter appears in the URL query string preceded by p_. A query with id 1234 and the following query text:

SELECT * FROM table WHERE field = {{param}}

Would have link a like so: https://app.redash.io/<slug>/queries/1234?p_param=100

This is useful for linking between queries and dashboards.

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a dynamic link to a query
